summary: This is an email chain between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and the FBI regarding a defense witness list in the Epstein case. The prosecution requests the FBI to investigate and prioritize contacting individuals on the list, noting many have previously come up in the investigation. Attachments include notes on three specific individuals.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, requesting the FBI to investigate the defense witness list.

events.title: Prosecution Requests FBI Review of Defense Witness List
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office emails the FBI, providing the defense witness list and requesting investigation into the named individuals, many of whom have previously appeared in the investigation.

keyFacts: The prosecution shared a defense witness list with the FBI for investigation on December 11, 2021.
The prosecution noted that many individuals on the defense witness list had previously come up in the investigation.
The email included attachments with defense notes for three specific individuals: GRAMZA, MICHELLE, and HAMILTON.
The correspondence indicates ongoing coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and the FBI regarding witness vetting in the Epstein case.
